answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!A high blood pressure in pregnancy can be harmful both to mother and to the baby. Your gynecologist is right. Ideally the pressure should fall while standing up. This could be due to the pregnancy itself (blood pressure rises in pregnancy and then goes back to normal) or it could be due to preeclampsia. Presence of a high blood sugar in pregnancy associated with a higher blood pressure can cause further problem. Please go back to the gynecologist or seek another opinion regarding this. Both the high BP and high sugar will have to be managed in order to avoid complications in future. Take care!

question: I am a little over 26 weeks pregnant and the day of my ob appointment I was having dizziness and feeling faint with my heart racing only when I would stand up.  I would sit and feel better but as soon as I stood up slowly I would feel my pulse shoot up and start to feel faint.  I tried walking around a bit and drink some water but nothing helped.  I told my ob at my appointment and she checked my pulse and blood pressure both laying down and standing up.  She said when I did stand, my blood pressure and pulse both shot up.  She said she thought my blood pressure would have dropped.  She admitted me to the hospital and a doctor said I could possibly have hyperglycemia and released me.  I just don't think my symptoms fit this.  Is it possible I have hyperglycemia?
title: Heart racing and dizziness when standing up
